articles.basic_headline: ASML shares rise on CFO Dassen's comments on orders
articles.title: ASML shares rise on CFO Dassen's comments on orders
articles.description: ASML shares rose on Wednesday after a Jefferies analyst report cited comments from CFO Roger Dassen which suggested he was positive about the possibility of orders coming through from top customer TSMC in the coming quarters.
articles.web: ASML shares rise on CFO Dassen's comments on orders

thumbnail.caption: ASML logo is seen near computer motherboard in this illustration taken January 8, 2024. REUTERS/Dado Ruvic/Illustration/File Photo
thumbnail.alt_text: Illustration shows ASML logo
thumbnail.subtitle: Illustration shows ASML logo

articles.basic_headline: ASML, Belgium's Imec open laboratory to test newest chip-making tool
articles.title: ASML, Belgium's Imec open laboratory to test newest chip-making tool
articles.description: ASML , the biggest maker of equipment used to manufacture semiconductors, said on Monday it has opened a test laboratory for its High NA EUV lithography equipment, together with Belgium chip research firm Imec.
articles.web: ASML, Belgium's Imec open laboratory to test newest chip-making tool

thumbnail.caption: ASML logo is seen near computer motherboard in this illustration taken January 8, 2024. REUTERS/Dado Ruvic/Illustration/File Photo
thumbnail.alt_text: Illustration shows ASML logo
thumbnail.subtitle: Illustration shows ASML logo

articles.basic_headline: Nvidia says its next-generation AI chip platform to be rolled out in 2026
articles.title: Nvidia says its next-generation AI chip platform to be rolled out in 2026
articles.description: Nvidia Chief Executive Jensen Huang said on Sunday that the company's next-generation artificial intelligence (AI) chip platform was called Rubin and would be rolled out in 2026.
articles.web: Nvidia says its next-generation AI chip platform to be rolled out in 2026

thumbnail.caption: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang speaks at event ahead of the COMPUTEX forum. in Taipei, Taiwan June 2, 2024. REUTERS/Ann Wang
thumbnail.alt_text: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang speaks at event ahead of the COMPUTEX forum, in Taipei
thumbnail.subtitle: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang speaks at event ahead of the COMPUTEX forum, in Taipei

articles.basic_headline: Exclusive: Google, augmented reality startup Magic Leap strike partnership deal
articles.title: Exclusive: Google, augmented reality startup Magic Leap strike partnership deal
articles.description: Alphabet's Google and augmented reality startup Magic Leap are forming a strategic technology partnership and working on building immersive experiences that blend the physical and digital worlds.
articles.web: Google, augmented reality startup Magic Leap strike partnership deal

thumbnail.caption: The logo of Google is seen at the Viva Technology conference dedicated to innovation and startups at Porte de Versailles exhibition center in Paris, France, June 14, 2023. REUTERS/Gonzalo Fuentes/File Photo
thumbnail.alt_text: VivaTech conference dedicated to innovation and startups in Paris
thumbnail.subtitle: VivaTech conference dedicated to innovation and startups in Paris

articles.basic_headline: SK Group chief ordered to pay $1 bln in divorce case; shares in SK Inc soar
articles.title: SK Group chief ordered to pay $1 bln in divorce case; shares in SK Inc soar
articles.description: A South Korean court ruled SK Group Chairman Chey Tae-won must pay more than $1 billion to his estranged wife as part of their planned divorce, sending shares in the group's holding firm surging on speculation that he will have to purchase more stock to cement his control.
articles.web: SK Group chief ordered to pay $1 bln in divorce case; shares in SK Inc soar

thumbnail.caption: Chairman & CEO of SK Holdings, SK Innovation and SK Hynix, Chey Tae-won, a former SK Group chairman and still a major shareholder of the group, poses during an interview with Reuters in Seoul January 27, 2013. REUTERS/Lee Jae-Won /File Photo
thumbnail.alt_text: Chairman & CEO of SK Holdings, SK Innovation and SK Hynix, Chey Tae-won poses during an interview with Reuters in Seoul
thumbnail.subtitle: Chairman & CEO of SK Holdings, SK Innovation and SK Hynix, Chey Tae-won poses during an interview with Reuters in Seoul

articles.basic_headline: New Samsung chip division head says committed to overcoming challenges in AI era
articles.title: New Samsung chip division head says committed to overcoming challenges in AI era
articles.description: Samsung Electronics' new head of its chip division has called on staff to work together to regain the company's status as a top semiconductor company, adding he is committed to overcoming challenges in an age of artificial intelligence.
articles.web: New Samsung chip division head says committed to overcoming challenges in AI era

thumbnail.caption: The logo of Samsung is seen on a building during the Mobile World Congress in Barcelona, Spain February 25, 2018. REUTERS/Yves Herman/File Photo
thumbnail.alt_text: The logo of Samsung is seen on a building during the Mobile World Congress in Barcelona
thumbnail.subtitle: The logo of Samsung is seen on a building during the Mobile World Congress in Barcelona

articles.basic_headline: Arm offers new designs, software for AI on smartphones
articles.title: Arm offers new designs, software for AI on smartphones
articles.description: Arm Holdings on Wednesday unveiled new chip blueprints and software tools to help smartphones handle artificial intelligence tasks, along with changes to how it delivers those blueprints that could help speed their adoption.
articles.web: Arm offers new designs, software for AI on smartphones

thumbnail.caption: A smartphone with a displayed Arm Ltd logo is placed on a computer motherboard in this illustration taken March 6, 2023. REUTERS/Dado Ruvic/Illustration/File Photo
thumbnail.alt_text: Illustration shows Arm Ltd logo
thumbnail.subtitle: Illustration shows Arm Ltd logo

articles.basic_headline: South Korea investigating two Samsung workers exposed to radiation
articles.title: South Korea investigating two Samsung workers exposed to radiation
articles.description: South Korea's nuclear safety authorities said on Wednesday that they have launched an investigation after two workers at a Samsung Electronics chip plant were exposed to radiation.
articles.web: South Korea investigating two Samsung workers exposed to radiation

thumbnail.alt_text: The logo of Samsung is seen on a building during the Mobile World Congress in Barcelona

articles.basic_headline: Samsung Electronics' union threatens first ever walkout next week
articles.title: Samsung Electronics' union threatens first ever walkout next week
articles.description: A Samsung Electronics union in South Korea will begin escalating strike action next week by staging the first ever walkout over demands for higher wages, union officials said on Wednesday.
articles.web: Samsung Electronics' union threatens first ever walkout next week

thumbnail.caption: The National Samsung Electronics Union (NSEU) members hold banners that read "Respect labour" in front of the Samsung Electronics Seocho Building in Seoul, South Korea, May 24, 2024. REUTERS/Kim Soo-hyeon/File Photo
thumbnail.alt_text: The National Samsung Electronics Union (NSEU) hold a rare protest for fair treatment, in Seoul
thumbnail.subtitle: The National Samsung Electronics Union (NSEU) hold a rare protest for fair treatment, in Seoul

articles.basic_headline: South Korea, UAE agree to slash import duties, strengthen ties
articles.title: South Korea, UAE agree to slash import duties, strengthen ties
articles.description: South Korea and the United Arab Emirates signed a trade agreement at a summit on Wednesday to sharply cut import duties and forge closer business and investment ties.
articles.web: South Korea, UAE agree to slash import duties, strengthen ties

thumbnail.caption: United Arab Emirates President Sheikh Mohamed bin Zayed Al Nahyan (L) and South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol (R) attend at a welcoming ceremony at the Presidential Office in Seoul on May 29, 2024.     JUNG YEON-JE/Pool via REUTERS
thumbnail.alt_text: UAE President Sheikh Mohamed bin Zayed Al Nahyan visits South Korea
thumbnail.subtitle: UAE President Sheikh Mohamed bin Zayed Al Nahyan visits South Korea

articles.basic_headline: UAE president visits South Korea with defence and energy on agenda
articles.title: UAE president visits South Korea with defence and energy on agenda
articles.description: United Arab Emirates President Sheikh Mohammed bin Zayed Al Nahyan arrived in South Korea on Tuesday, where his plane was met by an honorary escort of four fighter jets before he landed for his first state visit to Asia's fourth-biggest economy.
articles.web: UAE president visits South Korea with defence and energy on agenda

thumbnail.caption: UAE President Sheikh Mohammed bin Zayed al-Nahyan arrives for a meeting at the Elysee Palace in Paris, France, July 18, 2022. REUTERS/Benoit Tessier/File photo
thumbnail.alt_text: UAE President Sheikh Mohammed bin Zayed al-Nahyan visits France
thumbnail.subtitle: UAE President Sheikh Mohammed bin Zayed al-Nahyan visits France

articles.basic_headline: Prosecution appeal begins for Samsung chief Lee over 2015 merger case
articles.title: Prosecution appeal begins for Samsung chief Lee over 2015 merger case
articles.description: A South Korean high court began on Monday hearing a prosecution appeal over a decision by a lower court to clear Samsung Electronics chairman Jay Y. Lee of all charges in a case related to a 2015 merger of Samsung companies.
articles.web: Prosecution appeal begins for Samsung chief Lee over 2015 merger case

thumbnail.caption: Samsung Electronics Chairman Jay Y. Lee leaves a court in Seoul, South Korea, February 5, 2024. REUTERS/Kim Soo-hyeon/File Photo
thumbnail.alt_text: Samsung Electronics Chairman Jay Y. Lee leaves at a court in Seoul
thumbnail.subtitle: Samsung Electronics Chairman Jay Y. Lee leaves at a court in Seoul

articles.basic_headline: China talks security, business with U.S.-allied South Korea, Japan
articles.title: China talks security, business with U.S.-allied South Korea, Japan
articles.description: Chinese Premier Li Qiang agreed with South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol on Sunday to launch a diplomatic and security dialogue and resume free trade talks, and discussed tensions around Taiwan with Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida.
articles.web: China talks security, business with U.S.-allied South Korea, Japan

thumbnail.caption: Chinese Premier Li Qiang arrives to attend the trilateral summit with his South Korean and Japanese counterparts  in Seoul, South Korea, May 26, 2024. REUTERS/Kim Soo-hyeon
thumbnail.alt_text: Chinese Premier Li Qiang visits Seoul
thumbnail.subtitle: Chinese Premier Li Qiang visits Seoul

articles.basic_headline: Samsung encouraged to invest more in China, Premier Li Qiang says
articles.title: Samsung encouraged to invest more in China, Premier Li Qiang says
articles.description: Chinese Premier Li Qiang told Samsung Chairman Jay Y. Lee on Sunday that China welcomed further investment by the Korean conglomerate, state news agency Xinhua reported, as foreign businesses in the Chinese market struggle to navigate geopolitical uncertainties.
articles.web: Samsung encouraged to invest more in China, Premier Li Qiang says

thumbnail.caption: Chinese Premier Li Qiang arrives to attend the trilateral summit with his South Korean and Japanese counterparts  in Seoul, South Korea, May 26, 2024. REUTERS/Kim Soo-hyeon
thumbnail.alt_text: Chinese Premier Li Qiang visits Seoul
thumbnail.subtitle: Chinese Premier Li Qiang visits Seoul

articles.basic_headline: Amid chants and K-pop, Samsung union stages rare rally for fair wages
articles.title: Amid chants and K-pop, Samsung union stages rare rally for fair wages
articles.description: Against a backdrop of K-pop performances and dance music, more than 2,000 unionised workers from Samsung Electronics gathered in Seoul on Friday, holding a rare rally to demand the South Korean technology giant pay fair wages.
articles.web: Amid chants and K-pop, Samsung union stages rare rally for fair wages

thumbnail.caption: A member of the National Samsung Electronics Union (NSEU) holds a placard that reads "Respect labour" in front of the Samsung Electronics Seocho Building in Seoul, South Korea, May 24, 2024. REUTERS/Kim Soo-hyeon
thumbnail.alt_text: The National Samsung Electronics Union (NSEU) holds a rare protest for fair treatment, in Seoul
thumbnail.subtitle: The National Samsung Electronics Union (NSEU) holds a rare protest for fair treatment, in Seoul

articles.basic_headline: Japan companies hog the spotlight as hedge funds tout their top Asia picks
articles.title: Japan companies hog the spotlight as hedge funds tout their top Asia picks
articles.description: Japanese stocks were in focus at a hedge fund conference this week, accounting for most of the top Asia investment ideas as asset managers highlighted Japan Inc's efforts to improve capital efficiency as well as the record run for Tokyo shares.
articles.web: Japan companies hog the spotlight as hedge funds tout their top Asia picks

thumbnail.caption: A businessman walks in Tokyo's business district, Japan January 20, 2016.  REUTERS/Toru Hanai/File Photo
thumbnail.alt_text: A businessman walks in Tokyo's business district, Japan
thumbnail.subtitle: A businessman walks in Tokyo's business district, Japan

articles.basic_headline: Exclusive: Samsung's HBM chips failing Nvidia tests due to heat and power consumption woes, sources say
articles.title: Exclusive: Samsung's HBM chips failing Nvidia tests due to heat and power consumption woes
articles.description: Samsung Electronics' latest high bandwidth memory (HBM) chips have yet to pass Nvidia's tests for use in the U.S. firm's AI processors due to heat and power consumption problems, three people briefed on the issues said.
articles.web: Exclusive: Samsung's HBM chips failing Nvidia tests due to heat and power consumption woes

thumbnail.caption: The logo of Samsung is seen on a building during the Mobile World Congress in Barcelona, Spain February 25, 2018. REUTERS/Yves Herman/File Photo
thumbnail.alt_text: The logo of Samsung is seen on a building during the Mobile World Congress in Barcelona
thumbnail.subtitle: The logo of Samsung is seen on a building during the Mobile World Congress in Barcelona

articles.basic_headline: Micron hit with $445 million US verdict in Netlist patent trial
articles.title: Micron hit with $445 million US verdict in Netlist patent trial
articles.description: Chipmaker Micron Technology owes computer-memory company Netlist $445 million in damages for violating Netlist's patent rights in memory-module technology for high-performance computing, a U.S. jury said on Thursday.
articles.web: Micron hit with $445 million US verdict in Netlist patent trial

thumbnail.caption: Visitors look at a memory wafer at a Micron Technology kiosk before the start of 'SemiconIndia 2023', India's annual semiconductor conference, in Gandhinagar, India, July 25, 2023. REUTERS/Amit Dave/File photo

thumbnail.subtitle: Visitors look at a memory wafer at Micron Technology kiosk before the start of 'SemiconIndia 2023' in Gandhinagar

articles.basic_headline: Applied Materials gets another subpoena on China customer shipments
articles.title: Applied Materials gets another subpoena on China customer shipments
articles.description: Applied Materials disclosed on Thursday that it received another subpoena from the U.S. Department of Commerce in May, as regulators request more information on shipments to China.
articles.web: Applied Materials gets another subpoena on China customer shipments

thumbnail.alt_text: Illustration shows Applied Materials logo
thumbnail.subtitle: Illustration shows Applied Materials logo

articles.basic_headline: South Korea unveils $19 bln package to compete in global chip 'warfare'
articles.title: South Korea announces $19 billion support package for chip industry
articles.description: South Korea announced on Thursday a 26 trillion won ($19 billion) support package for its chip businesses, citing a need to keep up in areas like chip design and contract manufacturing amid 'all-out warfare' in the global semiconductor market.
articles.web: South Korea announces $19 billion support package for chip industry

thumbnail.caption: Semiconductor chips are seen on a printed circuit board in this illustration picture taken February 17, 2023. REUTERS/Florence Lo/Illustration/File Photo/File Photo
thumbnail.alt_text: Illustration picture of semiconductor chips
thumbnail.subtitle: Illustration picture of semiconductor chips
